message_1: In modal logic, the Box operator is used to represent necessity. If Box(p) means it is necessary for p to happen, and Box(q) means it is also necessary for q to happen, what does Box(p and q) represent?
message_2: In modal logic, Box(p and q) represents the necessity of both p and q happening together. It means that it is necessary for both p and q to be true simultaneously.
